reviewText:
Mortal Online is truly a unique game that delivers a hardcore sandbox MMO like no other.

I have played Mortal for several years before Steam release so ignore my low hours played, it's more like a few hundred or more. Subscribing to this game is worth every penny!

What about Mortal do I love? Why you might like this game!

-Forced first person skill based MMO (When you swing you can hit the arms, legs, head etc.) Combat is not simple like most other games, there is no aim assist or TAB and button mash. A skilled player with less player attributes and worse gear can truly destroy a lesser skilled player with better attributes and gear.

-Sandbox. There IS a brief intro quest and that's it. You are free to explore, hunt, craft, learn. You are not bound by a quest system. There is no need to grind quests.

-The crafting! Never have I seen a game with more in depth crafting. You don't just go out and find iron, bring it to a bench and craft a weapon. You must go mine rocks, (they are everywhere) bring them to an extractor (crusher etc) which gives some basic parts, burn them in a forge, and refine them with other parts, this is the most realistic type of crafting I have seen in a game, ever. I could go on and on about the complexity and how rewarding it is but you get what I'm saying hopefully.

-FULL LOOT and NOWHERE IS SAFE! This is awesome. Are you the good" guy that strives to kill only red (murderer) players and defend the peace? Are you a "bad" guy that wishes to kill everyone they see and take what they have on them? Either way this game caters to it. Yea there are blue cities that the guards kill red players but even so anyone can attack
date: they will turn grey and the guards may kill them but it's not truly safe even in the big cities.\n\nIn a nutshell
recommended: I love this game.  It's not going to hold your hand
hoursPlayed: it will test your patience at times. The rewards are great
voteText: nothing beats that feeling of knowing you could die
helpfulPercent: but you made a long trek to the next city with your valuables
votesHelpful: ETC.\n\nThe game is not perfect
votesTotal: but for an indie development team they have made a hidden gem of a game. They are not going away and they are always improving the game.\n\nAfter Mortal Online
votesFunny: other games feel tame and useless. (Other games have little or no penalty for death and therefore are not rewarding to me).\n\nThumbs up if this review was helpful."

reviewText: Graphics? Kinda suck... even running everything on max, details only show when your right up to something. Optimization needed. Gameplay? Not bad really. There is a lot I want to so badly love about this game. Here are my main complaints: everything is so spread out you spend hours just trying to get to the other of a town. The terrain and world itself is just plain boring. Combat is fresh and unique. The game mechanics are great, just crippled by everything else. The F2P is nerfed pretty badly and the community is largely against new players. Veterans will literally go to new zones and kill new players out of sheer boredom I would assume. Combine that with the full loot system means they will kill you, destroy what you've spent hours obtaining for no reason at all until they run out of newbs and finally move on. Just so another one can come in. And all that is yours to experience IF you can get logged on in the first place. For something thats been around since 2009 you think they would at least have figured out a stable launcher. Seems like is a lot to offer if you ever get there, but I doubt it.

reviewText:
This game has some potential in its skill and progression system, but the world is sloppy, there is no lore, there is frequent waits to log in, and a lot of lag.

the mechanics are solid and I found the learning curve not to hard but challenging.

The biggest problem is only subscryption players have thief skills, and all players are fair game at all times. while this could seem like small things, without any real restraint structure this means you have an uncontrolable infestation of greafers and people just looking to puff up there own egoes.

this is a digital fight club, NOT a fantasy MMO

Death is the only thing that has no value, meaning this is more like Immortal online, you will quickly find yourself gripping about your loss of copper (Sorry Cuprum) or a weapon when you die, rather than actual death.

If that sounds fun to you have at it, but it's not for me.

reviewText:
http://imgur.com/a/oEPGZ (Boxed version, 2009 account.)

It's truly a 'sandbox' experience unlike any other. Skills work like they do in Oblivion, and it's incredibly satisfying watching yourself progress.

Game looks beautiful, it plays (mostly) well except combat which is a little touch and go. I wish there was a 'neutral' review as after conversing with a Dev. on the forums they seem very reasonable; so I have no choice but to sway slightly positive. What started off as a giant rant by myself about the game, turned around to a civil conversation which I assume neither of us imagined. Overall the game would be much more positive with a different community.

The game has potential, unfortunately I've been saying that for well over 6 years now. Some things need to be changed drastically to improve gameplay, and the primary reason the game is failing is due to the community.

It is plagued by elitists and trolls. People who believe because they can dupe, exploit, and min/max whatever mechanic is broken at the time that they have the right to treat people however they want. Wander somewhere a clan deems as 'theirs' and try to gather? Have fun getting spawn killed for hours at a time until you give up and log out.

The crafting system is absolutely stunning, but again the elitists have full control over the market. There are no 'recipes' so everything is trial and error unless someone else tells you what is required. This leads to game breaking potions and other items only a select few know about and will hold onto their secret like it's the one ring".

People are so scared of challenge
date: so terrified of someone being on their level they will do everything they can to prevent you from accomplishing anything in the game.\n\nYou will be 'blue blocked' and killed by guards
recommended: I imagine more times than you can count in your first days in the game.\n\nIt's free
hoursPlayed: so it can't hurt to try. It's the only full loot
voteText: FPS combat MMO worth playing."

reviewText:
After finding this offer online for free and giving it a shot for a straight run of seven hours I can summarize that this MMORP is a compromise. The game elements are easily identifieble and like any other MMORPG this one is 'pay to win' with the free accounts serving as a permanant trial, being unable to progress into a situation where your character has any chance against: guilded players marauding the countryside, lone horsemen murdurers, pick pockets, 'low level' griefers, fatigue free hostile animals and many more, I find it difficult to find the positive in a 'full loot' environment where 4+ hours of grinding can be erased with a stroke of another player's hand (or a mouse click rather)

The combat system is clunky. The animations are delayed on both attacking and defending making the victor 'he who has a lower ping' combined with 'he who has managed to attain a powerful weapon'. Stamina is easily depleted and forces the player to stop and stand in place, or submit to a static animation (sleep or sit) and 'ranking' it up requires well thrice more investment in time spent training one specific skill. (or multiple skills) and similar goes for the majority of the other 'skills' that I've learned about. Certain portion of the 'skill tree' seem redundant- for example, the multiple different kinds of anatomy studies acquired when skinning different animals, or the variation of wood type lore which all feel like a weighted shackle on the road to adventure.

This MMO failed to deliver me with a unique immersion and like other similar (LIFYO for example) it funnels down to a grinding game, which completely beats the notion of Role Playing to me and leaves me questioning the purpose of an anarchy situation. Are they hoping that the players create the story? And if so, how could they if they are always busy killing each other? - With guilds involved I was speculating this might be the answer but to my disappointment the guild scene is a closed clique party with most guild towns being locked under passowrd or a sassy toll.

If you are expecting an immersive story where you might create your character and bring it into a story based adventure, this is not your stop. - If you are, however, just looking for a grinding & power building game, this is it!

As far as the technicalities go;
The game world is detailed compared to other MMOs i've seen recently. It is however not as large as I've hoped it would be. (in 7 hours i've explored most of the main continent) The tutorial which grants you some basic items and skill knowledge is very to the point and fluid making it easy for everyone to understand. The time divisiion is quite fair, with night time not being too dark and day time not being too bright and the over-all scenery is very nice with how the moon is possibly the planet and the game world being the moon in this setup (speculation only).

In short, I feel that this game focuses too much on statistics, attirbutes and other red tape rather than the immersion of adventure and discovery which is why I feel it's less RPG and more MMO and I would not recommend it at this point of writing.
voteText: 5 of 12 people (42%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
A Medieval fantasy game with a freaking lots of stuffs to focus on.
The game is sandbox, and it tries to be as realistic as possible, including that there will be hunger, no starting maps, no global banks(town banks doesn't connect with other town's banks), stealing, securities, housing, etc etc etc.

Combat is pretty much skyrim, you have your stamina, you adjust your distance at your enemy, you strike with either swinging or thrusting, and of course they will have durabilities, you can parry and block, and there are also magics, and Full looting system.
There is no level system in this game, so you have full skill points and attribute points ready to be allocated by doing stuffs(reading skill books, activities that corresponds said skill, etc).
Skill points are limited, there are 2 types of skill, primary and secondary, primary spends skill points, secondary spends none.
You can hit people in towns and even killing them, but hitting innocents will cause you to be a criminal and be chased by op guards capable of 360 noscoping you with magics and arrows

--EDIT--
After putting in few more dozens of hour into the game, i want to add something new here, the game suffers from crashing issues, and it doesn't tolerate disconnection, you got disconnected? your characters will have to wait either 10 or 40 seconds before logging out following you, will the same thing happen if you crashed? well... yeah.

Anyways, my experience with the game has been both good and bad, i found new way to make money, got excited, got to live in a man made guild base, seeing my tamed mounts sell, killing and finding new monsters, realizing that the monster's loot is a fortune to sell, etc.
being a f2p dude, i decided to make my character a hybrid to spend those unused skill points, i decided to become a hybrid fighter and a tamer, and it worked well, i might not fight as good as my other guild mates, but i still had fun coordinating with my good teammates.

The starting town(mainly Tindrem) is but a one's place to suffer and grow before finally deciding to venture outside for an adventure, as i've said before, this game got no map, but they gave you compass, a working one, you should hone your pathfinding and exploration skill, or you could roleplay as a hireable bodyguard, there are people actually people looking for an escort from one town to the other.

--EDIT--
Pros and Cons

---Pros---

-Multiple ways to gain currency, tamer(selling pets), crafter(Selling eqs), Extractors(Selling extracted / advanced resources), PK-ers (Spoils of w-, player killing). Thief(stealing stuffs)
-Combat is not typical.
-Great crafting system.
-Broad selection of creatures to be tamed.
-Broad skills and career selections.
-Open world, vast areas to be explored.
-Guilds.
-etc.
---Cons---
-Not newbie friendly(Punishing deaths, blueblocking, returning alive is a bit troublesome, Sandbox Confusions, etc), most newbies decided to stop playing this game after experiencing that the game is too punishing and confusing for them.
-Stucks, jumping to some location might result on you getting stuck forever.
-Cooldown on /stuck, a command which helps stuck players.
-f2p limitations, the max points to be allocated on one skill for f2p players are 60, subscriptions players have no limitations
-f2p tamers can't tame dem' cool minotaurs ;_;
-f2p players can't steal.
-crashes.

reviewText:
This makes me sad, because the game itself is so much fun. Too bad that the rest of it is so inexcusably amateur and poorly planned/executed.

There are many valid points being made below for and against this game, and a few of them are actually true.  The main problem with this title is that it is so difficult to log into the game. Whether you are a p2p or f2p player, you will not be able to play whenever you want, Period. Every session is a gamble. One day you can log on and the next day you can't.

All of this boils down to an amateur dev team and amateur leadership directing them. I just can't believe some people are actually paying subscriptions to this. I would never pay for a game that only lets me log in 3-4 times a week.

I didn't even go into bugs and issues with the game itself yet, of which there are PLENTY. Mortal Online is literally, the first clear example of a game concept so good that it didn't matter if the execution missed every single develpment target.

You will definitely enjoy this game if you like spending more than an hour trying to log in 5+ times EVERY SINGLE WEEK. Today is a US national holiday, so don't even think about trying to log in. It's 6PM and everyone trying to log-in after 10AM still can't get in.

NOTE TO OTHER DEVELOPERS: THIS GAME CONCEPT IS A PLATINUM SELLER, BUT THIS COMPANY FUMBLED IT HORRIBLY. PLEASE PICK UP THIS BALL AND RUN WITH IT.

reviewText:
A Medieval fantasy game with a freaking lots of stuffs to focus on.
The game is sandbox, and it tries to be as realistic as possible, including that there will be hunger, no starting maps, no global banks(town banks doesn't connect with other town's banks), stealing, securities, housing, etc etc etc.

Combat is pretty much skyrim, you have your stamina, you adjust your distance at your enemy, you strike with either swinging or thrusting, and of course they will have durabilities, you can parry and block, and there are also magics, and Full looting system.
There is no level system in this game, so you have full skill points and attribute points ready to be allocated by doing stuffs(reading skill books, activities that corresponds said skill, etc).
Skill points are limited, there are 2 types of skill, primary and secondary, primary spends skill points, secondary spends none.
You can hit people in towns and even killing them, but hitting innocents will cause you to be a criminal and be chased by op guards capable of 360 noscoping you with magics and arrows

--EDIT--
After putting in few more dozens of hour into the game, i want to add something new here, the game suffers from crashing issues, and it doesn't tolerate disconnection, you got disconnected? your characters will have to wait either 10 or 40 seconds before logging out following you, will the same thing happen if you crashed? well... yeah.

Anyways, my experience with the game has been both good and bad, i found new way to make money, got excited, got to live in a man made guild base, seeing my tamed mounts sell, killing and finding new monsters, realizing that the monster's loot is a fortune to sell, etc.
being a f2p dude, i decided to make my character a hybrid to spend those unused skill points, i decided to become a hybrid fighter and a tamer, and it worked well, i might not fight as good as my other guild mates, but i still had fun coordinating with my good teammates.

The starting town(mainly Tindrem) is but a one's place to suffer and grow before finally deciding to venture outside for an adventure, as i've said before, this game got no map, but they gave you compass, a working one, you should hone your pathfinding and exploration skill, or you could roleplay as a hireable bodyguard, there are people actually people looking for an escort from one town to the other.

--EDIT--
Pros and Cons

---Pros---

-Multiple ways to gain currency, tamer(selling pets), crafter(Selling eqs), Extractors(Selling extracted / advanced resources), PK-ers (Spoils of w-, player killing). Thief(stealing stuffs)
-Combat is not typical.
-Great crafting system.
-Broad selection of creatures to be tamed.
-Broad skills and career selections.
-Open world, vast areas to be explored.
-Guilds.
-etc.
---Cons---
-Not newbie friendly(Punishing deaths, blueblocking, returning alive is a bit troublesome, Sandbox Confusions, etc), most newbies decided to stop playing this game after experiencing that the game is too punishing and confusing for them.
-Stucks, jumping to some location might result on you getting stuck forever.
-Cooldown on /stuck, a command which helps stuck players.
-f2p limitations, the max points to be allocated on one skill for f2p players are 60, subscriptions players have no limitations
-f2p tamers can't tame dem' cool minotaurs ;_;
-f2p players can't steal.
-crashes.

reviewText:
This game requires you to think.  If you love PvP and like a challenge, then I would sincerely suggest you give it a try.  The artwork is very detailed, but the graphics are not like those found in most modern games.  Also, the idea is to try and figure a lot out for yourself.  Here is one example of what I mean.  I have one character that is an alchemist.  I can look at previous recipes others have figured out and were willing to post.  However, I spend a lot of time with that charater gathering and testing various items to see if they produce anything viable.  That character cannot fight.  She cannot do anything but alchemy.  When she finds viable recipes, she can make money.

A person could make a decent hybrid if they cannot afford to pay for the game.  A mounted archer is one possible hybrid.  The system is fairly complex.  You get 1100 points to use for primary skills and an unlimited number of points to use for secondary skills.  The catch is that you can't always open a secondary skills immediately.  Sometimes you need a certain number of points in the primary skill first.  50 in endurance allows you to learn some secondary skills, as an example.  You can lock a skill at any point.  You can reduce a skill you don't want and allow it to increase again later.  My alchemist has some survival abilities, but she is using most of her 1100 points for alchemy related reasons.

Here is a little more info for those interested:  The fact you can change your character at any point is wonderful.  Just make sure your stats will work with your new combo.  However, the world is cruel.  You are never 100% safe.  It is basically an open field and anyone willing to risk death by a guard can still attempt to kill you in town.  Some towns have no rules.  Some are player owned.  There is no map in game.  Anyone can loot your corpse if you die.  Although to loot an innocent, results in your character becoming a target for 2 minutes.  Outside of town, you either have a way to defend yourself, roam in groups, hang out with guild buddies or prepare yourself for an eventual death.

Still interested?  If so, I am guessing you like the idea of world PvP and game that requires some thought.  Just be prepared to die a lot at first.  There is a definite learning curve.

I am not the gamer my husband is.  However, I have definitely logged enough hours over the past many years to call myself an experienced, old-school gamer.  This is probably only the second time in all those years I have written a review.  That is how much I love this game.  Hope to see you soon!

reviewText:
In short, a fantastic game. Pay to win? No. It's Pay to play. I started off believing I would never buy a subscription for the game and continue as a F2P like I have many other games but this one is special. It's basically what ESO should have been. It's an MMO with first person only and enough stuff to do that some players have been playing for years and never been bored. You can tame numerous creatures. Build your own city. Band together all your friends and go murder wanderers or even guards if you're brave.

TL;DR amazing game. Amazing environment. Feel free to add me if you're have trouble starting the game as a noob

-Curson

reviewText:
This game isnt for everyone, when you first play this game the first few hours feel as if you have been thrown into a hungry lions cage. everything wants you dead in this game lol, but that for me is why im loving this game so much this game really is ruthless.

this is a hardcore mmorpg not to be taken lightly and you need to have your wits about you while playing this game.
i dont know how to do reviews so all im going to do is tell you about this morning in my life of mortal online..

i woke up in meduli ive been here selling donkeys and other ridable animals to players i earned enough gold to buy a new spellbook that teaches me even better animal control but to buy this book i need to travel from meduli north to tindrem... carrying all my 65 gold.. (if i bump into a murderer then hes going to kill my weak taming ♥♥♥ and take all my hard earned gold) i chose my fastest horse and set off, half way there i hear thundering footsteps a group of 4 murderers comes out behind the treee obviously cutting off trade routes but i planned my jeourney first i was naked horse back riding only carrying my 65 gold. i just chanced it and said yo guys its me... they withdrew there swords and warned me not to stay on the east coast haha didnt even know them i made it safely with my 65 gold and got my daamn book lol.. the tension this game brings doing small things like this is going to keep me playing for a very very long time.

the crafting system im only just starting to delv into and it is that complex that my mind nearly exploded out of my ears..
this game is Dark souls meets runescape meets world of warcraft.. mixed with a first person view. highly recomended to the gamer who enjoys a bit of hardcore gaming

reviewText:
This game rather baited me in with the prospect of a free world to just do whatever in, but it boils down to going solo and pouring all your points and skills into what you need to SUPPORT the skill you want to focus on. God forbid you want to swing swords but don't want to learn how to make armor, swords, and how to fight, along with cooking, mining, and wood cutting. I consider the free to play version to be nothing more than a trial, like on WoW.

The way the game is designed makes it almost impossible to figure out for a new player, take my advice and don't even download this headache, look elsewhere.

By the way, by hardcore, they mean people who exist for PvP and ganking. Especially those weaker than themselves.

reviewText: This game is not easy to understand first of all. The entire system is pretty much based on the fact that you have to rely on the help of others to do anything, or figure things out on your own. Not 15 minutes into the game was I killed by a player(s) because I hit another player for stealing from me. There is a mechanic to call a guard, and many times did I try and no guard came. I could not figure out the issue so I hit the player away from me, he ran away and I was immediately swarmmed and killed, losing all I had, and therefore making me never want to play Mortal Online again. If this was my fault in the end for doing something wrong, I would at least like to know how to do it properly next time, yet the help features available were no help at all. The game is long, drawn out, and not friendly to new players, even in the starting town. I think the game could be good, but they have not done enough to make it good, nor have they fixed what seems to be broken. Not a fun game unless you like grinding resources for hours at a time only to die because someone out in the world finds you and kills you. And you won't get your items back. The most fun I had with my time was the character creation, and that's pretty sad.

Poor graphics quality aside, as a new player you will have your stuff stolen repeatedly by players runnign in front of you whilst you are trying fight enemies. This will then turn you criminal when you accidentally hit them allowing them to kill you without consequence and steal all your stuff.

You can always file a support ticket though right? Not unles you are willing to wait hours whilst being in game. What a joke.

Definately do not recomend this game. This is not a steep learning curve, it is players using exploits to steal your things.

reviewText:
I've played just about every MMO out there and have several thousand hours invested in playing them (Over 2000+ hrs in Rift + ArcheAge on Steam alone) and this one is just painful..

A couple of my major gripes..

1) Graphics look like they are from the Everquest days. However, the inexusable part is the terrible modeling done by the designers. The textures/models  are so heavily reused.. they need some variety and stop painting the world with the same generic rock terrains.

A simple example was the frill grass poking up from the starting towns fountain.. just raise the base height to hide the frill. That's just lazy modeling by the developers. It looks terrible to have the grass poking out of the middle of a stone fountain.. (Which used the same stone texture without any shaders.. Very ugly to look at - Ingame is far uglier than the screenshots)

2) Combat was ok.. The fact that archery hits are calculated client side on the archer's machine is a bit annoying. It doesn't account for leading or latency.

I admit that I didn't give it much time to get into deeper aspects of combat, but I can't get past how ugly the game is..

3) Min/Max builds only - It seems the game has only a few viable builds, though it offers numerous skills. So, this leaves most people with a cookie cutter planner for maxing their toon.. It seems you end up with a minimum of three characters to experience the full gameplay  - One PvP, and two crafters.

This was off putting for me.. I have a full schedule, so leveling / managing three characters is not appealing. I prefer to have one character that I can spend building up.. I really don't want to waste time switching characters just to keep the cash flowing - that seems like just a time sink to avoid creating content.

If you enjoy hardcore pain.. (Such as drowning in a fountain, lol) You might like this one, but if you are like me and want to play a game that is less work and more entertainment, then stay away. The full loot and heavy PvP lured me in to give it a try.. but ultimately, it was just too ugly to give it much of a chance.

reviewText: Been playing this game since Block B beta off and on. Most of the things people talk about are completely avoidable by being clever and doing things at the right time. Sometimes you won't be able to leave that city exactly when you want, or have to take a longer route. Sometimes you will lose a days progress or more. It's a game you've got to put some time into your first play through. Bank everything, get your money in silver and join a guild. These three lessons will save you tons of time and frustration. All in all, it is a great game that deserves the mixed reviews.

reviewText:
First off, let me mention that this isn't a beautiful game, nor a smooth running one


However, it is one of the few MMO's in english that have free style combat (not cycling your attacks like WoW, Guild wars, runescape) and alongside this have Collision based mesh combat (your weapon actually has to hit the persons charecter) AND you lose everything when you die (well, close to) Now most people see this as a negative, however this is exactly what i've been looking for.

enjoying this game even though it's a little laggy :D

reviewText: This game is really fun if you're willing to play it for 1 week or so, if you wish to play longer than that you have to pay, why? Because most of the players out there pay the subscription and they get full content (f2p only get 60% of what p2p players get) and you can barely do anything with that 60% if you're willing to get further in the game. There are a lot of bb (blue blockers, players who come in front of you while you're killing some mobs so you'll turn grey, someone would kill you and they'd  get your stuff) and griefers (players who kill you for no reasons) . The game is not that well adapted (For example i can play skyrim at medium-high settings but i can barely play this game at low-medium, and it's not because of the players, i've played BDO (black desert online) at medium settings with 45 fps (which is also open world and has way more players than MO) but when im playing MO with Medium setting i barely get 20 fps. And as i said, if you want to go further in the game, you gotta pay, otherwise you're gonna be stuck at killing pigs for 20 silvers.\n\nIt's one of the most incredible game ever if you pay the subscription, if you have a really good PC and if you play with friends/ if you get in a guild.

reviewText: OK so I've been playing mmo's since the age of 14 and I love them I've been looking around for a hard one based around skill and I thought no levels, no classes, and its based around skill I thought perfect. So after the surprisingly short wait I go throught a semi-unique character creation set and choose a tutorial level. It took well over 10 minuites for me to kill my first pig. Slowly I got better at it but I had no clue how to make it into the leather needed. The help chat is on a limit and then your on your own. I spent about half an hour trying to recover gear due the terrible swimming mechanics so if anyone wants extreamly basic gear and thinks they can get it look under one of the bridges in the starting area. Over all good game but the mechanics are very wonkey and the community is dumped in toxic sludge. Ign would rate 8.5/10 moderate ammount of drowinging.

reviewText:
This review is not going to be about the game so much. The game is old, but parts of it are interesting despite this, the skill system, the combat system, this is all fine.

What ruins it are the people.

DM's who actively support the abuse of their flag system to allow high end players to gank new players with no reprecussions.

A HELP community, who also actively supports this.

No way for a new character to leave the main town without being killed, the guild ROT tends to hang out outside it and murders any players who leave.

There might be some good players, somewhere, but if they are there they have been ineffecitve at stemming the tide. This game actively promotes griefing against new players, and deserves to die. Help it do so.

reviewText:
The Shaggy Dog With A Murderous Heart of Gold
The three hours I spent being camped by squeakers and blueblocked was not completely unenjoyable. The freedom and agency afforded to players in this game is a breath of fresh air in today's look-but-don't-touch, theme park MMO scene.

Less can be said for the six hours I spent in log-in queues and loading screens because the client crashed (again). There's a brilliant game under this mess and I pray that they get it sorted some day. I pray but, my hopes are (EDIT:) cautiously optimistic.

Best Nudity Simulator: 2009

reviewText:
10/10 coming from a A-block beta tester that loved but hated the game with a passion.

Loved the concept of the game so much, I bought one of the early packs back in 08 if i remeber correctly. Played through all of the beta, played at launch like it was my religion, then it hit me. MO sucks-at the time. We have all been there, buy something the regret it down the road.

Skip ahead a few years like any other gamer....I still have the drive for this kind of game, only other outlet has been Eve Online, but since Incarna my hard on for that game has really took a dive for the floor. Back to Mortal Online, again ...<-----A mama mia thing, for those not so cultured. lol

Were was I? Oh ya...   Mortal Online after years of not playing, steam release!!!!!!!! What could go wrong, well ♥♥♥♥ login's. Wtf I just want to play! Let me in!...Alright calm down this could be good, PPL to maybe play with... wait...wait...wait.

I got in!!!! Crash, wtf. Wait...Wait...Wait...

Skip ahead a few week, I dont give up. MY<--------perfect MMO might be ready for me?

Log in, works the first time, yup! lucK!!! suckers i am playing, relog on a alt? yup ♥♥♥♥ u suckers again I am in!!!!!!

Play like tommarow is never going to come, loving every second of grinding, trolling, being ganked, ganking, getting my Ipooped pushed in by some noob. Well how could this game get any better?
Lets knock it down a notch to keep my may years of a pipe dream in check---twitch? Ya that will do it, so many ♥♥♥♥ lords there crapping on games, what do I find? let me tell you....<----

Few channels,but! Awsome channels. Gamers who have never played the game, completly loving it. What else did i find, game devs there hanging out answering question with the same passion I remember almost 7 years ago when i first found the game. Too boot!! Henrick was in the chat channels talking with us, being one of the dudes.

My dream game is finaly here, wish I could say I supported the game as long as it has been around, wish I could say I had faith in SV, wish I could say i was right. But I can tell you I have never been so extatic to be be proven so wrong. MO did it!!!!

reviewText:
I used to have a badish review and not reccomended for this game due to a bad login system and que where alot of the time you couldnt acutually get in the game. Since then they have fixed the que and the system actually gets you in immediatly usually if you are subbed, and within 5-10 min if you are ftp.

This game although oldish for an MMO, has been refreshed by steam and is now seemingly getting updates with future plans in the works for more.

I don't reccomend this game if you want rules and classes and quests and levels but if you want an anarchy do what you want play style where you do what you want somewhat remminicent of Eve Online then this is the game for you. I like it as an alternative to games where you are overly restricted to levels and classes.

reviewText:
This game is amazing I have played this game for 3 years and everyday I logged in was always diffrent. Yes, I know the game kinda has a high system requirerment but that shouldn't know you from trying. If you really wanna get a feel for the game you need to first find a guild that has played for a while to help you get a better grip of the game. This is a sandbox type of game so there is no sense of direction cause you make your own quests and adventures. There are bugs but if you can get around it, It is a great game with awesome potential to be the best game. They are little to no games like mortal cause it is a First person only MMO that takes skill to get anywhere. People who are sub have an advantage but I have seen F2P that have beat pay to plays to the ground cause they have more skill than others. It has good graphics and amazing places if you step out of town you can find, For example the sator dungeoun or Mino, demon circle and risar dungeoun it is all one of a kind. The small dev team has done an outstanding job at this game.
So Remember or things to know:
-Find a guild to get a good stand point from the game and get expereince to build your own guild one day.
-There are grifers at all towns so don't be discouraged if you do get ganked, Its mortal guys xD
-Grind is hard but satisfactory when you reach your goal.
-Everyday will always be new.
-Last is a hardcore full loot PvP open game, You can be killed anywhere and I mean anywhere.
I may have missed some things but check out Jaseace's review cause it gets into more depth but this is all that I can say from playing for 3+ years So come on in you plebs and have some fun!
So do you have what it takes to be a Mortal or will you fall?

reviewText:
This game has captivated my attention for 4 years. I am involved in a tight niche of this game where you kill for your stuff. It has the greatest player envolvement in the landscaping of any MMO. The grudges are held eternally, and your reputation is notorious in this community.

There is something for everyone but the game is very hardcore. Death is brutal, items have actual value, and the grind is merely surviving the world and its denizens.

The bugs and the indy dev company can be frustrating at times, but the satisfaction of accomplishment is bar to none in any other MMO. This is more hardcore than Darkfall. In MO you don't kill someone, you murder them. You cause them grief, and killing is a political, ecnomical, and tactical action.

Good luck on your endeavors in Mortal Online, I will have my crew ready to murder everyone that joins in. Such is the freedom RPK! has in this game. Such is the freedom of Mortal Online.

reviewText:
I've played Mortal Online since Beta Block A, meaning I'm one of the first that bought this game. I've quit and came back to this game at least 10 times. I hate it but I also love it, it is a strange relationship i have with this piece of software to be honest. Now that I do not have a proper internet connection service, I can't really play but I'm trying to solve that problem and jump right back in.

Now this game is full of bugs, unstable server issues, a griefing population in cities, unfair flagging system and many other issues but let me explain what this game is offering, why is it different from other games?

-The most important thing is the players' influence over the world. This is not a semi-mmo with 100s of servers with only 40 people in it. This is a real breathing world with people who have different goals. There are political conflicts, rpk guilds playing the role of bandits, hire swords, trading guilds, player made cities for new players and sometimes even world wars that changes the whole game for everyone.
This being said MO is not a very solo friendly game. Even if you have all the characters you need, sustaining yourself while having fun turns into a job more than a game. You might follow this path, dont get me wrong it is entirely possible however I would not recommend it especially to a newbie.

-Exploration is a great aspect of this game. You have a wast land to wonder around and experience. You do not have a map in game so learning the terrain is important. Learning the safe routes, hidden places and farming areas would give you an advantage. Also there are different things that you can explore than the terrain and the world. There are tons of combinations that you can try in alchemy, crafting, cooking.. etc. There is no stamina or mana potion still in the game as far as I know, you could be the first one to invent them and make a fortune out of it!

-Combat is different than you would find in other mmos. First person view changes everything, I might be biased in this are because I love FPS it gives the most realistic feeling, forces you to be more careful about your surroundings and to me FPS helps me bond with the game by putting me right inside of the world.

-Mortal Online might not be the first game with the open world combat, without battlegrounds or instances but this game has a more tactical fight or flee type of combat once you get into it. For example having the high ground might change everything or herding your enemy to an open area with mounted fighters can change the course of battle. So the terrain is an important aspect in combat, knowing your way around it might save your life. This is not much of a difference you to other games you might think but with the full loot, knowing that you will lose something and hurt your/your guilds reputation if you die makes a whole a lot difference.

I'd say try it for yourself. As most of the people say here, it is not a game for everyone. But if you like it chances are you will not be able to quit it entirely as long as there is no other game like MO.

reviewText:
Lets start simple.
This game is hard, really hard.
Its unforgiving and brutal, the crafting is complex and in depth, with multiple ways to gather some of the necesary resources.

Combatively it is skill and equipment based, someone with better armour and weapons has a large advantage but is not necesarily unbeatable.

Though there is one place where the game falls down, but at the same time this is the games greatest strength.
The world. There is no quest system, the game will not tell you where to go or what to do.
It is up to the players to create the content, to start the wars and build great cities to set quests for newer players to help  kingdoms grow.
The world is populated with NPC animals and monsters, and in the town's and cities there are guards and merchants, but they sell only the most basic equipment and provide only so much protection.
Should you need a sword, you must find a player to make you one.
A helmet? find a friendly armour smith.

This game does not hold your hand, and it expects a certain amount of intelect from its players, you cannot come into this game and expect to be taken on a tour of the world and to see all the coolest parts just because you followed a line of exclimation marks on your minimap that has an arrow pointing to the next destination.

In this game you decide who you are.
Are you a brave adventurer? traveling between towns and seeking out the most fearsome beasts and the darkest caverns.
Are you a reclusive smith? only emerging from your work to gather more crafting supplies.
Are you a great mage? honing your mind into the weapon it is.
Perhaps you bandit? demanding payment for the lives of those you meet and taking both should they resist.

Or are you simply a poor pleb? stalking a graveyard full of the mindless dead who you almost seem to disopear amongst.

Those are but a few of the things you can do in this game, but it will now show you how, you must carve that path yourself.

reviewText:
Amazing game,

It is harsh, it is hard, it is unforgiving, it has flaws but it still is the ONLY game like it currently available. Nothing else really comes close in terms of hardcore mechanics (full pvp, full loot, open world, thieving, component specific crafting, breeding, territorial conquest etc)

The kind of mechanics available (kill a player-killer huting newbies in the graveyard and cook his head and body in a stew) or skin a buffalo and make armor from its bones and hide) simply fantastic! the level of freedom that exists in this game is astounding.

Yes, there are villians, plenty of them, but there are also heroes and kind people willing to help.

- If you want to experience something truely unique and you have lots of patience then give this game an honest go.

- If you are an impatient person who wants intant gratification, hates being killed and you cannot handle losing" game items/pixels then give it a miss."

reviewText:
A great idea for a game, but poorly executed.   The world outside of the main cities is pretty lifeless.  You can run for 20 minutes and come across the same trees and rocks you find in the city, which the city is in theory safer.  In reality you are more likely to be murdered in the PvE graveyard within the city than out in the wild.  Most likely this is because the murderers are so bored in the open, empty world the only place to kill is the starter zone.

The combat is clunky, and feels extremely out of date.  Movement is horrid.  Eventually developers may realize that only making sprint feel like a decent speed to move at, and then adding a stamina bar to limit sprint, is not very fun.  I found myself sprinting until out of stamina, resting for 5 seconds to refill the stamina, and then running again.  Overall it would probably be just as fast to go at walking speed, but that just feels too slow.

The skill system at first seemed interesting and deep.  Then you realize how pointlessly deep it is.  I'm not sure much is added to the game by having a skill for each of the following Zoology>Arthropoda>Chelicerata>Arachnida>Scorpiones, just to know about scorpions.  And unless you want to pay the monthly subscription, you're going to be capped at 60% compared to those who do pay anyway.

Save yourself the 10+gig download and skip this game.

reviewText:
This is a game...

First off, I'd like to start off by saying this is my first review.

This game has some of the most intersting content I have ever seen in a MMORPG. Mortal Online is the most true to genre hard-core, sandbox MMORPG's I have ever played.

Now I have played many RPG's, you could probably name any game and I have played it. This is a first in what I hope to be more games like this.

Now to start listing qualities:
MUSIC:
The music in Mortal Online is really inriguing. As a musician myself I always like to listen to the music in a game and think of the time and effort put in to making it. Now I don't know if they hired an orchestra or simply used midi files but it sounds pretty good.

GRAPHICS:
The graphics aren't too shabby. Although not comparable to a game like GW2, or Skyrim, they are more comparable to RoK. Although the graphics are not the best of the best, they do their job and show the in game content and crafting system, (which is the strongest part of the game).

CONTENT:
The most exciting part about this game is its content. The publishers really mean this game has a great crafting system. Since there are no real questing in this game, you the player has to create all of your gear from scratch. This truly sets everyone at the same level from start to finish. This also makes the game more based on skill and amount of time spent creating your character. Mortal Online also supports a subscribing system, since the game doesn't have 2 types of in game currencies, the only way to support the game financially is to have a sub system. This DOES NOT BREAK THE GAME. No one subscriber gets insanely amazing benefits from subbing. Subscribers get a few more skills they can enhance and a few other things. This makes it fun and playable for f2p gamers.
BONUS CONTENT: They have a nude setting which I find to be hilarious...

GAMEPLAY:
The overall game play isn't too bad. The mouse settings though are either TOO sensitive or TOO slow, there just doesn't seem to be an in between. Movement is alright and everything seems timed just right. Draw back, there is only first person viewing while playing the game. This goes hand-in-hand with the hard-core" aspect of game play.

Overall I give this game a 12/10 for nude setting"

Will continue to play MO for time to come."

Who's there?
FRANCISCO
Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.
BERNARDO
Long live the king!
FRANCISCO
Bernardo?
BERNARDO
He.
FRANCISCO
You come most carefully upon your hour.
BERNARDO
'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.
FRANCISCO
For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,
And I am sick at heart.
BERNARDO
Have you had quiet guard?
FRANCISCO
Not a mouse stirring.
BERNARDO
Well, good night.
If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,
The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.
FRANCISCO
I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?
Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS

HORATIO
Friends to this ground.
MARCELLUS
And liegemen to the Dane.
FRANCISCO
Give you good night.
MARCELLUS
O, farewell, honest soldier:
Who hath relieved you?
FRANCISCO
Bernardo has my place.
Give you good night.
Exit

MARCELLUS
Holla! Bernardo!
BERNARDO
Say,
What, is Horatio there?
HORATIO
A piece of him.
BERNARDO
Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.
MARCELLUS
What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?
BERNARDO
I have seen nothing.
MARCELLUS
Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,
And will not let belief take hold of him
Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:
Therefore I have entreated him along
With us to watch the minutes of this night;
That if again this apparition come,
He may approve our eyes and speak to it.
HORATIO
Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.
BERNARDO
Sit down awhile;
And let us once again assail your ears,
That are so fortified against our story
What we have two nights seen.
HORATIO
Well, sit we down,
And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.
BERNARDO
Last night of all,
When yond same star that's westward from the pole
Had made his course to illume that part of heaven
Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,
The bell then beating one,--
Enter Ghost

MARCELLUS
Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!
BERNARDO
In the same figure, like the king that's dead.
MARCELLUS
Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.
BERNARDO
Looks it not like the king? mark it, Horatio.
HORATIO
Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.
BERNARDO
It would be spoke to.
MARCELLUS
Question it, Horatio.
HORATIO
What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,
Together with that fair and warlike form
In which the majesty of buried Denmark
Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!
MARCELLUS
It is offended.
BERNARDO
See, it stalks away!
HORATIO
Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!
Exit Ghost

MARCELLUS
'Tis gone, and will not answer.
BERNARDO
How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:
Is not this something more than fantasy?
What think you on't?
HORATIO
Before my God, I might not this believe
Without the sensible and true avouch
Of mine own eyes.
MARCELLUS
Is it not like the king?
HORATIO
As thou art to thyself:
Such was the very armour he had on
When he the ambitious Norway combated;
So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,
He smote the sledded ♥♥♥♥♥♥s on the ice.
'Tis strange.
MARCELLUS
Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,
With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.
HORATIO
In what particular thought to work I know not;
But in the gross and scope of my opinion,
This bodes some strange eruption to our state.
MARCELLUS
Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,
Why this same strict and most observant watch
So nightly toils the subject of the land,
And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,
And foreign mart for implements of war;
Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task
Does not divide the Sunday from the week;
What might be toward, that this sweaty haste
Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:
Who is't that can inform me?
HORATIO
That can I;
At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,
Whose image even but now appear'd to us,
Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,
Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,
Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--
For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--
Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,
Well ratified by law and heraldry,
Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands
Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:
Against the which, a moiety competent
Was gaged by our king; which had return'd
To the inheritance of Fortinbras,
Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,
And carriage of the article design'd,
His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,
Of unimproved mettle hot and full,
Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there
Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,
For food and diet, to some enterprise
That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--
As it doth well appear unto our state--
But to recover of us, by strong hand
And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands
So by his father lost: and this, I take it,
Is the main motive of our preparations,
The source of this our watch and the chief head
Of this post-haste and romage in the land.
BERNARDO
I think it be no other but e'en so:
Well may it sort that this portentous figure
Comes armed through our watch; so like the king
That was and is the question of these wars.
HORATIO
A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.
In the most high and palmy state of Rome,
A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,
The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead
Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:
As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,
Disasters in the sun; and the moist star
Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands
Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:
And even the like precurse of fierce events,
As harbingers preceding still the fates
And prologue to the omen coming on,
Have heaven and earth together demonstrated
Unto our climatures and countrymen.--
But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!
Re-enter Ghost

I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!
If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,
Speak to me:
If there be any good thing to be done,
That may to thee do ease and grace to me,
Speak to me:
♥♥♥♥ crows

If thou art privy to thy country's fate,
Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!
Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life
Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,
For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,
Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.
MARCELLUS
Shall I strike at it with my partisan?
HORATIO
Do, if it will not stand.
BERNARDO
'Tis here!
HORATIO
'Tis here!
MARCELLUS
'Tis gone!
Exit Ghost

We do it wrong, being so majestical,
To offer it the show of violence;
For it is, as the air, invulnerable,
And our vain blows malicious mockery.
BERNARDO
It was about to speak, when the ♥♥♥♥ crew.
HORATIO
And then it started like a guilty thing
Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,
The ♥♥♥♥, that is the trumpet to the morn,
Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat
Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,
Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,
The extravagant and erring spirit hies
To his confine: and of the truth herein
This present object made probation.
MARCELLUS
It faded on the crowing of the ♥♥♥♥.
Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes
Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,
The bird of dawning singeth all night long:
And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;
The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,
No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,
So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.
HORATIO
So have I heard and do in part believe it.
But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,
Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:
Break we our watch up; and by my advice,
Let us impart what we have seen to-night
Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,
This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.
Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,
As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?
MARCELLUS
Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know
Where we shall find him most conveniently.
Exeun

reviewText:
THE 30 SECOND REVIEW OF THE GAME:

Skyrim Online.  You can be a warrior, a thief, a mage, a do-gooder, or a murderous prick.  You can also be a crafter and make armor, weapons, potions, food, and tame animals and rideable mounts.  You can build houses, castles, entire towns and cities.  The game is first person only.  The combat is a hit based detection system, the melee has directional attacks and blocks that must be correctly timed.

Now remove the NPC quests.  Also toss in some resurrection priests for when you die.  Now make the game online only, with one server for the entire community to play on.

That's pretty much it.  What to do?  Kill eachother!  Imagine running around in Skyrim trying to kill mobs for loot, then having another dude sneak up on you and murder you.  Just like in Skyrim, you would lose everything you had on you.  You're in a town, and a thief steals your money--same as in Skyrim, but now its another player doing it to you.  The entire drama and story of this game is player created, which means it doesn't end, and everything you do can have real consequences in the form of alliances, wars, etc.

It's made by a small developer, and therefore can be buggy and slow to update.

8/10


THE LONGER REVIEW OF THE GAME:

Ok, so here's a much more detailed review.  I've played this game subscribed on and off for close to 2 years (since fall 2013).  I have multiple accounts, am in one of the larger guilds in the game, but busy life/work schedule keep me from playing much these days.  With that said, here's a non-rage, experienced review by someone who has tried just about every profession, and tried much of what can be done in this game.

This first person MMO is the closest thing to ultima online out there, and for being committed to that level of freedom, full loot, sandbox experience, in itself separates this game from everything else out there.

Those same things that make this game great also make it difficult to learn, and often frustrating.  The learning curve is steep, and level of time required to become proficient and competitive (in the PvP sense) is high.  I honestly would say it takes a couple months just to really figure the game out.  But I appreciate a challenge, and the combat system is more skill based than most other MMO I've played, which I find far more exciting and rewarding when you win (especially when you nab a kill on someone with good gear or transporting gold--no farming needed today!).  There are very detailed crafting systems, in which discovery and experimentation is incredibly important.  For example, there are NO pre-set recipes for alchemy or food, you just start extracting and refining ingredients from foods (or crazy materials you would never imagine putting into a potion or food) and start mixing and mashing things together and see what happens.   The best weapons, armors, potions, etc, are all tested and figured out by the player community.  There are some things which people have kept secret and even I don't know how something is made / done after playing for years.  The creativity from the game community is impressive.  The politics in this game are also incredible (and sometimes hilarious) to witness, as there is no active PvE story or questline.  Instead, the conflict and story of this game is constantly created due to nothing other than the butting heads of the egos and personalities of the players--sometimes leading to an entire server war lasting weeks or months long.

My only advice -- group up, get in a guild, or play with a group of friends.  In my experience, this game is not for those who like to go solo.  You will become bored, usually get chased down by roaming bands of veterans looking for easy kills if wandering on your own, or just be outnumbered in most cases.  Even though it's a harsh game, being friendly and meeting others is how this game is best played.  I warn you though, with a full loot sandbox like this, there is a strong troll presence.

I would only recommend this game to those who are patient, mature (can handle murderous griefers trying to ruin your day) and want a challenge - this game will not hold your hand, and neither will I. If you enjoy a complex, full loot persistent world that can be incredibly rewarding.  Whether you want to rush into battles involving dozens (or even hundreds) of actual players trying to bash each others skulls, or discover new alchemy potions that no one else in the world knows, or set up as a merchant and crafter trying to obtain wealth, you get the complete freedom to choose how you want to play the game.  The game mostly revolves around fighting, which is fine by me, but those looking for a deep PvE experience should head elsewhere.

Also, I would recommend subscribing to the game.  I think the only viable free to play characters would be foot warriors or foot mages, you will be gimped on mounts, and crafting is crap on free to play accounts due to the skill cap.

As for bugs, over my time in this game they seem to be improving, but you can still have the the occasional glitch that drops you through the world, only to kill your mount and lose your gear, or your mount will suddenly stop following you and run off into the game world.  Or you will be riding along and get stuck on a cactus and someone sees you and kills you, and you can't do anything but watch.  At least they have a very active admin system that can respawn you and your gear and mount for most instances where the game screw you.  Post-steam launch the admins almost always respond to me within 5 minutes or less, which is far better than other MMOs I've played.  Remember, this is an independently developed game comprising a small team.

So I think this game deserves high praise for everything it has done right, especially given the small team and the limited resources.  They also deserve praise for not selling out and becoming another boring, safe MMO for the sake of trying to bring in more revenue.  I would recommend Mortal Online to anyone who enjoyes a challenging and persistant world MMO.   But, if you just want to jump into some action, and the full loot system just causes you more stress than enjoyment, I would move on to something that provides more immediate action and entertainment.


8/10

reviewText: So Uhh, I played it, it looked ugly, it felt awful, and I felt really bored the whole time. The idea of the game sounds great, you live in a fantasy world, doing basic quest, that so far have no sign to show you they're quests. When you first play, you're kind like in a safe mode, where you can't hurt anybody or steal anything, and nobody can do the same to you. But you'll see other players who don't have safe mode, and they just get killed over and over by Higher geared players. You'll read it's a dog eat dog world, but really it's more of, you make a character, you get so far in it till the timer runs out, and then anybody can kill you. If the game worked more like DayZ where you were just tossed into this world and you make your own path, I could understand that, but it doesn't do that very well in this. I give it a 4/10.

reviewText:
I previously gave this game a positive review just to draw in new blood from Steam, but heres the truth.

1. There is nothing to do. PvE is a Joke, NPC's are completely boinked. To counter this they gave them the ability to knock you down and render you unable to defend yourself for a few seconds. Unless of course you drop 100 points into a skill that has no use to you besides defending against those knockdowns.

2. Obtaining gear is a huge grind. You need 3 characters to support 1 combat character of your own. Characters that a new player doesn't even know how to build without help from others or extensive research through the forums.

3. Gathering the resources needed to make those characters is mindblowingly tedious for a new player. You will be killed on site by the majority of other players who will also kill your mount(required for gathering) and delete your haul because they themselves probably can't carry it.

4. Min/Max builds, nearly everyone aside from roleplayers are the exact same race/skill build. This varies from month to month as they change aspects of how skills affect things like damage bonus and combat speed. So If you want to stay truely competitive prepare to reroll that character you spent hundreds of gold & hours on every couple of months.

5. Two vastly empty continents, aside from the rediculousness that is Terrority Control. Ride across a wasteland of randomly placed AI that yield nothing of value to you, unless of course you dedicated an entire character to butchering their carcass. Wow look at that huge palisade a player has built, lets see if they are inside, nope! No incentive to login for these players at this point, they are gathering safely while offline thanks to Territory Control.

6. How is your ping? 100, no that will never do. Connect through your phone's wifi or start some torrent downloads as some packetloss and 400 ping will serve you better(Yes people really do this). Watch as your opponent seemingly stands in place attempting to hit you, while you run circles about him with your polesword dispatching him and his friends.

7. Broken weapons, better be packing a polesword(reinging champ) or flanged mace or you are about to get your ♥♥♥♥ pushed in.

8. In-Game staff & forum moderation. These helpful" fellows are pulled directly from the sesspool that is the Mortal Online community itself. Be careful who you decide to interact with
date: because chances are they have a friend in high places.\n\n9. Henrik
recommended: the CEO. For years we have pleaded with this guy. The entire community is up in arms about the above listed issues
hoursPlayed: yet he acts on none of them. He is either blind deaf or dumb. Maybe all three.\n\nThank god for steam

reviewText:
Has potential but it's rife with griefing which can often kill any joy you can get from the game. The veterans in this game seem to not have much to do so they've decided to kill their time by making life for new players as difficult as possible.

Other than that, the combat is clunky, it's like Chivalry with none of the polish, mobs can hit you whilst they are facing away from you, animations and movement look very awkward as well, blocking controls are rigid... Generally the combat revolves around parrying" (blocking just before the mob attacks absorbing most of the damage and allowing you to unleash a counter attack) after 10 minutes you are able to easily predict their strike patterns/timings and the combat just becomes a bore.

Graphics are bad
date: mostly because of really awful looking textures and the game is very buggy too
recommended: it feels like an Early Access and it is 5 years old already. There's a DX11 option for example but it's so unstable it's pretty much unplayable (Constant CTDs
hoursPlayed: lag etc). DX9 mode is a lot better in that regard but there's still many in-game related bugs that plague the game. Optimization is poor

reviewText: I like how the game is lined up. I also liked how its like you're living your person's life, and you can get really creative with your persons abilities/skills. However, it doesn't give you much help after the tutorial. And it only gives you tips on the super basic things. There is no map, however they do provide a compass... And you can ask guards where something is. But, with no idea of where it is exactly, you can be going in circles for hours. Overall, i'm gonna stop playing, i don't want to spend hours upon hours just figuring out where i'm suppose to go.

reviewText:
Has potential but it's rife with griefing which can often kill any joy you can get from the game. The veterans in this game seem to not have much to do so they've decided to kill their time by making life for new players as difficult as possible.

Other than that, the combat is clunky, it's like Chivalry with none of the polish, mobs can hit you whilst they are facing away from you, animations and movement look very awkward as well, blocking controls are rigid... Generally the combat revolves around parrying" (blocking just before the mob attacks absorbing most of the damage and allowing you to unleash a counter attack) after 10 minutes you are able to easily predict their strike patterns/timings and the combat just becomes a bore.

Graphics are bad
date: mostly because of really awful looking textures and the game is very buggy too
recommended: it feels like an Early Access and it is 5 years old already. There's a DX11 option for example but it's so unstable it's pretty much unplayable (Constant CTDs
hoursPlayed: lag etc). DX9 mode is a lot better in that regard but there's still many in-game related bugs that plague the game. Optimization is poor
voteText: even with a very good system I cannot run this game at full settings.\n\nCommunity is annoying (other than griefers)
helpfulPercent: no criticism towards the game is accepted (fanboys)
votesHelpful: any criticism will be met with "Go back to WoW"
votesTotal: "Carebear" et cetera.\n\nThe game is often described as hardcore but honestly it doesn't take much thought or skill (in fact it takes almost none)
votesFunny: the only thing "hardcore" thing about the game is the constant hurdling you'll get from griefers/PKers and how much of your time will be wasted because of it
commentsCount: it's just a timesink/grind really. Either way

column18: I play it and do get some enjoyment out of it but I'm not foolish about what this game is and isn't as well.\n\nIf you're looking at this game you probably already have some interest in these type of games so for that reason I'll recommend to try it given that it has an unlimited trial."

reviewText:
I was speeding my donkey through town. I accidentally ran someone over which is an illegal offense. The guard executed me and my donkey immediately. Revived at the nearest priest. Walked to the bank. Pulled out 10 gold pieces. The 10 gold pieces were then immediately robbed by a thief.

Best game ever...

5/5

reviewText: I thought the horses looked nice and the taming aspect was interesting. My personal goal of taming and selling horses as a free to play player was accomplished but I would never pay money for this game. You start off in a PvTrolls environment and you move on to a PvGank environment (that's if you even run into anyone else) and then you end on a PvSkillcap. Pay or be fodder.

reviewText: With Theivery rapant in this game, and no ability to save your possessions, nothing is safe. It breaks the game economy making this a pointless game to spend money on. The game is far from balanced, even though it tries to suggest it is. Archery attacks are crap at best and not accurate at all for damage, speed, or accuracy. their version of mages must be bogged down with having to carry all these encumbering items, so that you fall easy pray to melee characters, and magics must be charged like a Dragonball z  where everyone is annoyed it took 2 epsiodes to charge a attack. The game, due to players and mechanics, revolves around stealing and killing each other, and considering it takes most 30 minutes to a hour to make 1-5 gold, even though there is alot of pve to earn said gold, ( pay players, and only pay players have the ability to steal), steal it from you waiting in droves around the banks so you can not save it,  and bank it, and if you don't bank it, they kill you and run off the moment your not visible to a guard. Making it so players are too scared to leave cities, and keep them in a eternal loop of being robbed, and killed over and over, to generate money for subscribers, bascially if your not paying, it's not worth playing, and it's not worth paying for, cause they can just take what you pay for too. horriable player community. IF you attack them, the guards will kill you, and then the vultures descend on your items. Every crime is punished by death. Without having a paid account your skills will never get high enough to defend against them and run away in time. The only part I liked was the melee combat which is much like Chivilary. Too bad you can't keep gold to get decent items, like melee weapons, armor etc, and if you get lucky enough to keep it, they do soemthing that occurs so much it has it's on nick name, dubbed blue blocking, where they run infront of your attacks on pve to make you hit them, to get the guards to kill you so they can legally steal your stuff. No other language other then english is allowed in their so called help chat either, which isn't even Gm's its the players I just mentioned, help chat is only 48 hours long, and there is a ednless amount of long time players who create alternate characters just to ploy new players into being gulliable so they can take your stuff as well.  They need hcanges and help if they want this to go anywehre and become mainstream. I can not forsee any future in which this game will make the company alot of money since the desgin itself of the economy structure is self deficating, probabaly why most never heard of this 6 year old game, till it came to steam.

-Realizing I'm a criminal now I do the most logical thing and run
-Wait, I should take his carcass
-I run back to his carcass and start eating it

10/10 would sacrifice life to be a cannibal again.

Started the game. Its a okay game if you have no life and just want to grind and grind after dying and dying.
Not a game for me but maybe you will find it interesting. Afterall its a free game."
